alert.note: Alert for Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 6:20PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Wake County through 715 PM EDT... At 618 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a couple of strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Falls Lake to 2 miles north of Knightdale. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Raleigh, Wake Forest, Zebulon, Knightdale, Wendell, Rolesville, Falls Lake, Falls Lake State Rec Area, Falls Lake Boat Ramp and Purnell. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. Boaters on the open water and those camping outdoors are especially vulnerable to the dangers of lightning. Seek harbor immediately and find safe shelter in a nearby building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for central North Carolina.
